channel.title: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?
channel.description: i am wondering who all uses 637/639s as their pic kof choice bc ive noticed there is lil to none tuts or downloads for 637/639s..i understand alot of people here dont due to the coding is not the greatest

I seriously wouldn’t recommend that because of what I put in there. I think everything I made had a few bugs, but I wasn’t that good with java at all. I’m pretty decent now.

item.source: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?

item.title: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?
item.dc:creator: @holylouis holylouis
item.description:
@holylouis wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:2, topic:538545”]I use 637. The code inside my source is like 99% mine because I have completely removed everything but networking and have been putting some work into it for a week and a half.

My player loading and saving uses a DataStream. My interfaces are handled by an interface state superclass. My container is more efficient and supports multiple types. I’ve written degrading and is loaded by XML. My spells are loaded from a folder. My combat is pretty much perfect. I still have to write every skill, minigame, and monster. It’s pretty much a remake in another person’s perspective. You shouldn’t judge the code if you can’t re-write it.[/quote]
ik u use 637 bc im using urs
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,540876.msg3961268.html#msg3961268

Read full topic
item.source: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?

item.title: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I doubt it’s because of ‘poor code’ otherwise nobody would be using matrix, pi, delta, winterlove etc

It’s more down to what version people like to play. I personally love 508 and 530’s but that’s just me.

Read full topic
item.source: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?

item.title: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I use 637. The code inside my source is like 99% mine because I have completely removed everything but networking and have been putting some work into it for a week and a half.

My player loading and saving uses a DataStream. My interfaces are handled by an interface state superclass. My container is more efficient and supports multiple types. I’ve written degrading and is loaded by XML. My spells are loaded from a folder. My combat is pretty much perfect. I still have to write every skill, minigame, and monster. It’s pretty much a remake in another person’s perspective. You shouldn’t judge the code if you can’t re-write it.

Read full topic
item.source: How many people use 637/639s in the mopar community?
